role.descr: first or all entities being segregated

example.name: intransitive
example.text: ``We must either integrate honestly or segregate honestly.''

example.name: transitive
example.text: The union sued the state in November 1985, alleging that it intentionally segregated job classifications by sex and paid employees in predominantly female jobs less than males in comparable jobs.

example.name: with destination
example.text: ``By encouraging massive, routine, voluntary testing we can enable society to voluntarily segregate itself sexually into two groups: those who carry the virus and those who do not,'' the Indianapolis research organization said in a new report.
example.arg: into two groups: those who carry the virus and those who do not

example.name: with source
example.text: John-1 failed *trace*-1 to segregate his red socks from Mary's delicate white underthings when doing laundry.

example.name: all args
example.text: However, the policies are conspicuous for their segregation of the world of women from that of men.

example.name: arg1 and argM-GOL
example.text: Cohesion between sister chromatids is generated during DNA replication and maintained until their segregation into two daughter cells.

example.name: args 1 and 3
example.text: The interactive map shows the economic segregation of 10 metropolitan cities.

example.name: another arg3
example.text: The racial segregation of schools has been a central concern of education policy since the. Supreme Court's 1954 Brown v. Board decision.
